column1: #High Quality Maintained: Post-trimming Q30 rates improved across all samples, reaching above 92.7%, which is excellent.
#Low Adapter Contamination: Only one sample (KO_SRR13633858) had detectable adapter sequences.
#Low Discard Rates: Reads lost due to low quality or being too short were minimal (~2‚Äì3% total).
#Duplication Rates: Ranged from 56.8% to 60.9%. This is relatively high, likely due to single-end sequencing and possibly high sequencing depth or low-complexity libraries.
Post-trimming **Q30 rates improved across all samples**, reaching above **92.7%**, which is excellent.
Only one sample (**KO_SRR13633858**) had detectable adapter sequences.
Reads lost due to low quality or short length were minimal (**~2‚Äì3% total**).
Ranged from **56.8% to 60.9%**. This is relatively high, likely due to **single-end sequencing** and possibly high sequencing depth or low-complexity libraries.
‚úÖ Overall, trimming improved **base quality** while keeping **most reads intact**, ensuring the dataset is clean and ready for downstream analysis.
